datafield.subfield: ʻAyn al-Quḍāh, Muhḥammad ibn ʻAbd Rahḥmān,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 486
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper suggests 16th or early 17th century.
Accompanying materials: Acquisitions slip from Yahuda (paginated pp.1-2).
Former shelfmark: From spine label and inscription on interior of upper cover, "IL 154 " (likely supplied by Yahuda, see Acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in yellow-tinted laid paper with spine in tan leather ; Type II binding (with flap) ; boardlinings in untinted paper ; sewn in grey thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in red and yellow, fair condition ; overall in fair condition with some abrasion, staining, etc.

Support: Mainly non-European laid paper with 8 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines visible and apparently grouped (perhaps in threes with roughly 39 mm. between groups), well-burnished and sturdy though not especially thick ; replacement leaves in European laid paper with 11 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 22-25 mm. apart (horizontal), and three hats watermark (compare Heawood 2595-2599).
Decoration: Some section headings rubricated ; textual dividers in the form of three inverted commas in red.

Script: Naskh ; two main Turkish or Persian hands, original and that supplying text of replacement leaves ; original hand mainly serifless, with slight effect of tilt to the left, curvilinear descenders, freely ligatured and thoroughly vocalized ; replacement hand serifless with pointing in distinct dots, some elongation of horizontal strokes, kāf mashkūlah (mashqūqah) preferred, and many open counters.
Layout: Written mainly in 15 lines per page (original) ; replacement leaves in 13-20 lines per page.

Collation: 7 V(70), II+1 (75) ; chiefly quinions ; a number of leaves not original, but replacement leaves ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes insert).

Explicit: "واعطي يوم الاثنين لمحمد صلى الله عليه وسلم ولثلاث وستون نبيا مرسلا صلوات الله وسلامه عليهم اجمعين واعطي الثلاثاء للانبياء صلوات الله عليهم اجمعين والاربعاء ليعقوب عليه السلام والخميس لادم عليه الصلوة والسلام والجمعة لامة محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم تم الكتاب بعون الله الملك الوهاب وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد وعلى اله وصحبه وسلم"

Incipit: "الحمد لله العزيز الجبار العزيز الغفار المهيمن الستار والصلاة على السيد المختار محمد سيد الابرار وعلى اله واصحابه المصطفين الاخيار ما تعاقب الليل والنهار وسلم تسليما فاعلم ان الخالق البارك خلت قدرته وعلت كلمته ... زين الاشياء السبعة ثم زين السبعة بسبعة اخرى ..."
Careful copy of a collection of preaching material for each day of the week. Description provided by Maxim Romanov.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Ownership statement on 'title page' (p.3) dated 1258 [1842 or 3] in name of Muḥammad ʻAlī Khārānī reads "ملكه محمد علي خاراني سنة ۱۲٥٨" ; octagonal seal impression repeated twice on lower board lining.
عين القضاة، محمد بن عبد رحمن.
